name: The Bug Owner's Handbook
description:
the bug owner's handbook

i started working on this dumb game earlier this year and then i just stopped but it was so close to being done that i just decided to jump into rpg maker a few days ago and actually complete a project. i don't do that very often. it's really not fun but and i don't know why it exists but maybe someone out there will enjoy it for like 2 minutes. i think i was playing cookie clicker and thought "this is great but it should be bugs instead" and for some fucking reason i made it. so basically u just go around finding money and new bugs that u can buy and then u can just leave the game window open and let ur profits build up. just leave it on overnight or something and ur good. check the little box in ur house, that's where bug money shows up. 

    issues to be aware of:

the yes/no choices look weird because rpg maker doesn't like my cool custom font. the text is a lot farther down than it should be and doesn't match up with the selection box thing. it kinda looks like u have to press down to select yes but yes is at the top and no is at the bottom. sorry. 

some text characters are huge and default because i forgot to make a custom one for them.

i think thats it but honestly i didn't playtest it that much so u can probably just sneeze on ur computer screen and break the game instantly. if u discover any problems not mentioned here then let me know and i'll see if it's something that i can fix.

    features:

  • original sprites & soundtrack
  • day/night cycle for some reason
  • cool bugs
  • nihilism
  • self loathing
  • video game
